channel.title: the story of tokamak: index on rfspine
channel.description: Recent content in the story of tokamak: index on rfspine

item.title: tokamak: from the ashes
item.description: tokamak wasn’t a new build. It comes from an older system, one with sentimental value, and it inherits this. From the ashes rise a new server Pretty much only the motherboard was the same. It was a socket LGA 1155, and I upgraded from a Celeron G1620 to a Xeon E3-1220 V2, which isn’t even supported on this entry-level motherboard, but somehow worked after adding a discrete GPU in the x1 slot.

item.title: tokamak: the beginning
item.description: I’ve had many computers. Some are still here. They’re powered on, or they’re in a closet waiting to be looked at again. Others are lost, many are forgotten, and too many are left behind. There are several computers that I keep around, either out of utility or for their history. Two in particularly come to mind - tokamak, and toshiba. This is the story of tokamak. The beginning tokamak was the first computer and the last computer I’ve ever built, in a way, even though I’ve built several.
